null.verse 21:15: A nepřestalo toto volání jejich, dokud jsme je jak obilí neskosili a životy jejich nezhasili.
null.verse 21:16: My nebesa a zemi a vše, co je mezi nimi, jsme pro zábavu nestvořili;
null.verse 21:17: kdybychom se byli chtěli pobavit, našli bychom si zábavu u Sebe, kdybychom už tak učinit zamýšleli.
null.verse 21:18: Naopak My pravdu proti falši mrštíme, a roztříští ji, a hle, ona se rozplyne; však běda vám za to, co lživě Bohu připisujete!
null.verse 21:19: Jemu náleží všichni, kdož na nebesích jsou a na zemi; a ti, kdož u Něho dlí, nejsou tak hrdopyšní, aby Mu nesloužili, a nikdy neumdlí
null.verse 21:20: a pějí slávu Jeho dnem i nocí bez přestání.
null.verse 21:21: Vzali si snad božstva pozemská, jež k životu probouzejí?
null.verse 21:22: Kdyby byla na nebi a na zemi božstva jiná kromě Boha, věru by obojí již zkáze bylo propadlo.
null.verse 21:23: A On nebude tázán na to, co koná.
null.verse 21:24: Či vzali si vedle Něho božstva jiná? Rci: "Předložte tedy důkaz svůj! Toto je připomenutí těm, kdož se mnou jsou, i připomenutí těm, kdož byli přede mnou!" Však naopak, většina z nich pravdu nezná a odvrací se od ní.
null.verse 21:25: A nevyslali jsme před tebou žádného posla, abychom mu nebyli vnukli: "Není božstva kromě Mne; uctívejte Mne tedy!"
null.verse 21:26: Hovoří: "Milosrdný si vzal děti!" Sláva Mu! Ba nikoliv, to služebníci jsou jen Jeho ctihodní,
null.verse 21:27: kteří se dříve než On promluvit neodvažují a jen podle rozkazu Jeho jednají.
null.verse 21:28: A On zná dobře, co je před nimi a co je za nimi, a oni se přimlouvat nesmějí, leč za toho, v němž On nalezne zalíbení; a oni se před Ním třesou bázní.
null.verse 21:29: A kdyby někdo z nich řekl: "Já božstvem vedle Něho jsem," toho bychom peklem odměnili, neboť takto My nespravedlivé odměňujeme.
null.verse 21:30: Což ti, kdož nevěří, nevidí, že nebesa a země byly pevně spojeny a že jsme je od sebe odtrhli a že z vody jsme vše živé učinili? Což neuvěří?
null.verse 21:31: A vztyčili jsme na zemi hory pevně zakotvené, aby se s nimi nekývala, a učinili jsme na ní průchody jako cesty - snad jimi budou vedeni.
null.verse 21:32: A učinili jsme nebe střechou chráněnou a přesto se oni odvracejí od Našich znamení.
null.verse 21:33: On je ten, jenž stvořil noc i den, slunce i měsíc a oba po nebeské své dráze plují.
null.verse 21:34: Žádnému ze smrtelníků, kteří před tebou byli, jsme nesmrtelnost nedali.
null.verse 21:35: Každá duše smrti okusí; a zkoušíme vás zlým i dobrým co pokušením, a k Nám budete navráceni.
null.verse 21:36: A když tě nevěřící spatří, posměšky si z tebe jen dělají a hovoří: "Je tohle ten, co zmiňuje se pohrdavě o božstvech vašich?" A při tom sami nevěří v Milosrdného připomenutí!
null.verse 21:37: Člověk je stvořen ze spěchu! Já ukáži vám záhy Svá znamení, však nežádejte jejich uspíšení!
null.verse 21:38: A říkají nevěřící: "Kdy slib tento se splní, jste-li pravdomluvní?"
null.verse 21:39: Kéž by znali ti, kdož nevěří, tu chvíli, kdy nebudou moci oheň odvrátit od tváří svých a zad svých a kdy pomoc žádnou mít nebudou!
null.verse 21:40: Ba, Hodina přikvačí na ně znenadání a v úžas je uvede a nebudou schopni ji zadržet a ani odklad nedostanou.
null.verse 21:41: A dělali si posměšky již z poslů předchozích, avšak to, čemu se posmívali, obklopilo ty, kdož tomu se posmívali.
null.verse 21:42: Rci: "Kdo ochrání vás za noci i za dne před Milosrdným?" A přece od připomenutí Pána svého se odvracejí!
null.verse 21:43: Mají snad místo Nás božstva jiná, jež bránit je budou? Ta nejsou schopna pomoci ani sama sobě, a oni jimi nebudou proti Nám chráněni.
null.verse 21:44: Ba naopak, nechali jsme je i otce jejich užívat světa tohoto tak, až prodloužily se životy jejich.
null.verse 21:45: Rci: "Já varuji vás jedině vnuknutím mně daným, však hluší neslyší volání, jsou-li varováni.
null.verse 21:46: A jestliže se jich dotkne jen jediné dechnutí trestu Pána tvého, vykřiknou: "Běda nám, my vskutku nespravedliví jsme byli!"
null.verse 21:47: A postavíme v den zmrtvýchvstání váhu spravedlivou a nebude duše žádná o nic ošizena; a i kdyby to mělo jen váhu zrna hořčičného, My je přineseme.
null.verse 21:48: A dali jsme již kdysi Mojžíšovi a Árónovi spásné zjevení, osvícení, i bohabojným připomenutí,
null.verse 21:49: těm, kteří se Pána svého kvůli nepoznatelnému obávají a před Hodinou se chvějí.
null.verse 21:50: A toto je připomenutí požehnané, Námi seslané.
null.verse 21:51: A darovali jsme již předtím Abrahamovi správné vedení, neboť jsme o něm věděli.
null.verse 21:52: Hle, pravil otci svému a lidu svému: "Co je to za sochy, jichž se tak usilovně přidržujete?"
null.verse 21:53: Odpověděli: "Shledali jsme, že otcové naši je uctívali.
null.verse 21:54: Pravil: "Vskutku vy i vaši otcové ve zjevném bludu jste!"
null.verse 21:55: I řekli: "Přišels k nám s pravdou, anebo jsi jedním z těch, kdo žertují?"
null.verse 21:56: Odpověděl: "Ba právě naopak! Váš Pán je Pánem nebe a země a On obé stvořil.
null.verse 21:57: Při Bohu, dozajista nastrojím úklad modlám vašim, jakmile záda vaše se obrátí.
null.verse 21:58: A rozbil je na kousky všechny kromě té největší z nich - snad oni sami se k ní navrátí.
null.verse 21:59: I řekli: "Kdo tohle božstvům našim udělal, ten věru mezi nespravedlivé patří!"
null.verse 21:60: A pravili jedni: "Slyšeli jsme mladíka nějakého o nich poznámky činit, Abraham mu říkají.
null.verse 21:61: I zvolali: "Přiveďte ho před oči lidí - snad budou proti němu svědčit!"
null.verse 21:62: A zeptali se jej: "Byls to ty, Abrahame, kdo s našimi božstvy se tohle odvážil učinit?"
null.verse 21:63: Odpověděl: "Nikoliv, to tenhle největší z nich udělal, zeptejte se jich, jestliže mohou promluvit!"
null.verse 21:64: Nevěřící se obrátili proti sobě a řekli: "Vy věru jste nespravedliví!"
null.verse 21:65: Potom však opět nastal obrat v hlavách jejich a prohlásili: "Ty přece víš, že vůbec nemluví!"
null.verse 21:66: Abraham pravil: "Pročpak tedy uctíváte vedle Boha něco, co vám ani neprospívá, ani neškodí?
null.verse 21:67: Hanba na vás i na to, co místo Boha uctíváte.
null.verse 21:68: Zvolali: "Upalte ho a pomozte božstvům svým, udělat něco chcete-li.
null.verse 21:69: Avšak My jsme pravili: "Ohni, vychladni a buď neškodným pro Abrahama!"
null.verse 21:70: A hodlali mu úklad nastrojit, však My jsme způsobili, že sami ztrátu největší utrpěli.
null.verse 21:71: A zachránili jsme jeho i Lota vedouce je do země, již jsme pro lidstvo celé požehnali,
null.verse 21:72: a darovali jsme mu Izáka a Jakuba nádavkem a všechny jsme bezúhonnými učinili.
null.verse 21:73: A ustanovili jsme je vůdci, kteří lid svůj řídí podle rozkazu Našeho, a vnukli jsme jim konání dobrého, dodržování modlitby a rozdáváni almužny - a byli služebníky Našimi.
null.verse 21:74: A dali jsme Lotovi osvícení a vědění a zachránili jsme ho z města, jež nepravosti páchalo a jehož obyvatelé byli lidmi špatnými a hanebnými.
null.verse 21:75: A uvedli jsme jej do milosrdenství Svého, neboť patřil mezi bezúhonné.
null.verse 21:76: (A zmiň) se o Noem, který již dříve Nás volal, a vyslyšeli jsme jej a zachránili jsme jej i rodinu jeho od pohromy nesmírné
null.verse 21:77: a pomohli jsme mu proti lidu, jenž prohlašoval znamení Naše za vylhaná.
null.verse 21:78: A zmiň se o Davidovi a Šalomounovi; hle, oni vynesli rozsudek o poli, jež poškodilo stádo ovcí lidí jedněch, a byli jsme svědky rozsudku jejich.
null.verse 21:79: A vnukli jsme Šalomounovi pochopení věci té a oběma jsme darovali osvícení a vědění.
null.verse 21:80: A naučili jsme jej vyrábět brnění pro vás, abyste se jimi chránili před útočností vzájemnou - budete za to vděčni?
null.verse 21:81: A Šalomounovi jsme podrobili vítr, jenž jako vichřice na rozkaz jeho duje k zemi, již jsme požehnali.
null.verse 21:82: A také některé satany jsme mu podrobili, aby se do moře potápěli či práce jiné proň vykonávali, a My jsme je při tom střežili.
null.verse 21:83: A zmiň se o Jóbovi, jenž volal k Pánu svému: "Postihlo mne neštěstí, však tys nejslitovnější ze slitovníků!"
null.verse 21:84: A vyslyšeli jsme jej a odvrátili od něho neštěstí, jež nesl, a vrátili jsme mu jeho rodinu a přidali ještě jednou tolik s nimi jako milosrdenství své a jako připomenutí těm, kdož Nás uctívají.
null.verse 21:85: A zmiň se o Ismaelovi, Idrísovi a Dhu l-Kiflovi - a ti všichni byli trpěliví,
null.verse 21:86: a uvedli jsme je do milosrdenství Svého a jsou mezi bezúhonnými.
null.verse 21:87: A zmiň se o Muži s rybou; když odešel rozzloben a domníval se, že proti němu nic nezmůžeme.
null.verse 21:88: I vyslyšeli jsme jej a zachránili jsme jej z útrap jeho.
null.verse 21:89: A zmiň se o Zachariášovi, když volal k Pánu svému: "Pane můj, neponechávej mne samotného, Ty, jenž z dědiců jsi nejlepší!"
null.verse 21:90: Vyslyšeli jsme jej a darovali jsme mu Jana a učinili jsme manželku jeho plodnou.
null.verse 21:91: A zmiň se o té, jež panenství své střežila.
null.verse 21:92: Hle, tato vaše obec je obcí jedinou a Já Pánem jsem vaším, uctívejte Mne tedy!
null.verse 21:93: Avšak oni se ve věci své mezi sebou rozpoltili, však přesto se všichni k Nám navrátí.
null.verse 21:94: Kdokoliv dobré skutky koná a je při tom věřící, tomu úsilí jeho věru nebude upřeno a zajisté mu je k dobru připíšeme.
null.verse 21:95: A je zakázáno městu každému, jež jsme zahubili, aby se obyvatelé jeho v ně navrátili,
null.verse 21:96: pokud nebudou vypuštěni Gog a Magog; a tehdy se lidé z každého hrobu vynoří!
null.verse 21:97: Pravdivý slib se přibližuje, a hle, strnulé jsou zraky těch, kdož neuvěřili.
null.verse 21:98: Vskutku vy i to, co jste místo Boha uctívali, palivem budete peklu a věru se doň dostanete!
null.verse 21:99: Kdyby tamti byli skutečnými božstvy, nebyli by se sem dostali; a všichni v něm budou nesmrtelní.
null.verse 21:100: A bude tam pro ně jen sténání, však nebudou v něm slyšeni.
null.verse 21:101: Ti však, jimž jsme předem slíbili odměnu překrásnou, ti od pekla budou vzdáleni
null.verse 21:102: a neuslyší z něho ani šelest nejmenší a v tom, po čem duše jejich toužily, budou nesmrtelní.
null.verse 21:103: Ani den hrůzy největší je nezarmoutí a andělé je přivítají slovy: "Toto váš je den, jenž byl vám přislíben!"
null.verse 21:104: V ten den svineme nebe, jako se svinují svitky knih, a jako jsme začali již prvním stvořením, tak opakovat to budeme podle slibu Námi daného.
null.verse 21:105: A věru jsme již napsali v žalmech, po připomenutí, že zemi podědí Moji bezúhonní služebníci.
null.verse 21:106: A je v tom zajisté sdělení pro lid Mne uctívající.
null.verse 21:107: A neposlali jsme tě leč jako znamení milosrdenství pro lidstvo veškeré.
null.verse 21:108: Rci: "Bylo mi vnuknuto jenom, že božstvem vaším je Bůh jediný.
null.verse 21:109: A jestliže se odvrátí, tedy rci: "Já varoval vás bez rozdílu a věru nevím, je-li blízko či daleko to, co vám bylo slíbeno.
null.verse 21:110: A On zná dobře to, co veřejně hovoříte, i to, co skrýváte.
null.verse 21:111: Nevím, zda to snad není pouze pokušení pro vás a dopřání vám užívat na určitou chvíli.
null.verse 21:112: Rci: "Pane můj, rozhodni podle pravdy!" Pán náš je Milosrdný a u Něho budiž vyžadována pomoc proti tomu, co lživě Mu připisujete! chvíli.

null.verse 21:1: Voor de mensen is de afrekening dichterbij gekomen en toch wenden zij zich in achteloosheid af.
null.verse 21:2: Er komt geen nieuwe Vermaning tot hen van hun Heer of zij luisteren er naar terwijl zij er mee spelen.
null.verse 21:3: En hun hart is achteloos.
null.verse 21:4: Zeg: "Mijn Heer, weet wat in de hemel en op aarde wordt gezegd; Hij is de Alhorende, de Alwetende.
null.verse 21:5: "Neen," zeggen zij, "verwarde dromen; neen, hij heeft het verzonnen; neen, hij is een dichter.
null.verse 21:6: Vóór hen (bewoners van Mekka) heeft nooit een stad geloofd die Wij vernietigden; zullen deze dan wel geloven?
null.verse 21:7: En vóór u zonden Wij slechts mannen aan wie Wij een openbaring hadden gezonden - Vraagt degenen, die de Vermaning bezitten, indien je het niet weet.
null.verse 21:8: En Wij maakten hun lichaam niet zodanig dat zij geen voedsel behoefden te gebruiken, evenmin dat zij voor eeuwen konden blijven leven.
null.verse 21:9: Aldus vervulden Wij aan hen Onze belofte, en Wij redden hen en degenen die Wij wilden; doch Wij verdelgden de buitensporigen.
null.verse 21:10: Wij hebben u een Boek (de Koran) nedergezonden waardoor je tot aanzien kunt komen, wil je dan met begrijpen?
null.verse 21:11: Hoe menige stad vol van ongerechtigheid hebben Wij vernietigd en na haar hebben Wij een ander volk verwekt!
null.verse 21:12: En toen zij Onze straf bemerkten, ziet, toen sloegen zij er voor op de vlucht.
null.verse 21:13: "Vlucht niet en keert terug tot de genoegens die u waren veroorloofd en tot uw woningen opdat je ondervraagd zult worden.
null.verse 21:14: Zij antwoordden: "Wee ons, voorzeker, wij waren onrechtvaardig.
null.verse 21:15: En hun geroep hield niet op totdat Wij hen nedermaaiden en uitblusten.
null.verse 21:16: Wij schiepen de hemel en de aarde en al hetgeen er tussen is, niet tot vermaak.
null.verse 21:17: Indien Wij een spel hadden willen doen, dan zouden Wij met Onszelf hebben gespeeld, maar dit doen Wij niet.
null.verse 21:18: Neen, Wij stellen de waarheid tegenover de valsheid zodat de eerste de laatste het hoofd breekt en ziet, zij vergaat.
null.verse 21:19: Hem behoort wat in de hemelen en op aarde is, en degenen die zich in Zijn tegenwoordigheid bevinden, zijn niet te trots om Hem te aanbidden, noch worden zij dit moede;
null.verse 21:20: Zij verheerlijken Hem dag en nacht, en zij verslappen hierin nimmer.
null.verse 21:21: Hebben zij (de afgodendienaars) goden genomen van de aarde die de doden kunnen opwekken?
null.verse 21:22: Indien er naast God andere Goden waren in (de hemel en op aarde) zouden dezen voorzeker tot chaos zijn vervallen.
null.verse 21:23: Hij kan niet worden ondertraagd betreffende hetgeen Hij doet, doch zij zullen worden ondervraagd.
null.verse 21:24: Hebben zij Goden buiten Hem genomen? Zeg: "Komt met uw bewijzen.
null.verse 21:25: En Wij zonden geen boodschapper vóór u zonder hem te openbaren: "Voorzeker er is geen God buiten Mij, aanbidt derhalve Mij alleen.
null.verse 21:26: En zij zeggen: "De Barmhartige heeft Zich een zoon genomen.
null.verse 21:27: Zij spreken niet eer Hij het beveelt, en zij handelen volgens Zijn gebod.
null.verse 21:28: Hij weet wat vóór hen is, en wat achter hen is, zij zijn voor niemand voorspraak behalve voor degene die Hem behaagt en zij sidderen uit eerbied voor Hem.
null.verse 21:29: En wie hunner zou zeggen: "Ik ben een God naast Hem," die zouden Wij met de hel vergelden.
null.verse 21:30: Hebben de ongelovigen niet ingezien dat de hemel en de aarde gesloten waren en dat Wij ze dan hebben geopend? En al hetgeen leeft, hebben Wij uit water gemaakt.
null.verse 21:31: En Wij hebben op aarde onwrikbare bergen geplaatst, opdat zij niet met hen (de mensen) zouden beven; en Wij hebben er wijde wegen gemaakt, opdat zij de juiste richting zouden volgen.
null.verse 21:32: En Wij hebben de hemel gemaakt tot een welbeschermd dak; niettemin wenden zij zich af van deze tekenen.
null.verse 21:33: En Hij is het, Die de nacht en de dag schiep.
null.verse 21:34: Wij hebben aan niemand vóór u een eeuwig leven geschonken.
null.verse 21:35: Iedere ziel zal de dood ondergaan en Wij beproeven u met kwaad en goed en tot Ons zul je terugkeren.
null.verse 21:36: Wanneer de ongelovigen u zien, spotten zij slechts met u, zij zeggen: "Is dit degene die kwaad spreekt van uw Goden?" terwijl zij het zijn die de verkondiging van de Barmhartige verwerpen.
null.verse 21:37: De mens is met een haastige natuur geschapen.
null.verse 21:38: En zij zeggen: "Wanneer zal deze belofte worden vervuld, indien je waarachtig bent?"
null.verse 21:39: O, wisten de ongelovigen maar de tijd wanneer zij niet bij machte zullen zijn het Vuur van hun gezicht of van hun rug te weren en niet zullen worden geholpen!
null.verse 21:40: Neen, onverwachts zal het hen achterhalen en het zal hen verbijsteren; en zij zullen niet bij machte zijn het te voorkomen, noch zal hun uitstel worden gegeven.
null.verse 21:41: Voorzeker werden de boodschappers vóór u ook bespot, maar degenen die hen bespotten, werden door het bespotte getroffen.
null.verse 21:42: Zeg: "Wie beschermt u dag en nacht behalve de Barmhartige?" Neen, zij wenden zich af van de gedachtenis aan hun Heer.
null.verse 21:43: Hebben zij goden die hen kunnen beschermen tegen Ons? Zij kunnen zichzelf niet helpen, noch worden zij door Ons bijgestaan.
null.verse 21:44: Neen, Wij hebben deze (mensen) en hun vaderen een voorziening gegeven totdat het leven hun verlengd werd.
null.verse 21:45: Zeg: "Ik waarschuw u slechts door Openbaring.
null.verse 21:46: En indien een ademtocht der kastijding van uw Heer hen raakt, zullen zij ongetwijfeld zeggen: "Wee ons, wij waren inderdaad onrechtvaardigen.
null.verse 21:47: En Wij zullen weegschalen der gerechtigheid instellen op de Dag der Opstanding, zodat geen enkele ziel in enig opzicht onrecht zal worden aangedaan.
null.verse 21:48: En Wij schonken Mozes en Aäron het Onderscheid, tot een licht en een gedachtenis voor de godvrezenden.
null.verse 21:49: Die hun Heer in het verborgene vrezen en het Uur duchten.
null.verse 21:50: En dit (de Koran) is een gezegende verkondiging die Wij hebben nedergezonden: zul je deze dan ontkennen?
null.verse 21:51: En voorheen schonken Wij aan Abraham zijn rechtschapenheid en Wij kenden hem goed.
null.verse 21:52: Toen hij tot zijn vader en tot zijn volk zeide: "Wat zijn deze beelden waaraan je zo gehecht bent?"
null.verse 21:53: Antwoordden zij: "Wij vonden dat onze vaderen deze aanbaden.
null.verse 21:54: Hij zeide: "Voorwaar, jij met jouw vaderen verkeert in duidelijke dwaling.
null.verse 21:55: Zij zeiden: "Heb je ons de waarheid gebracht, of speel je slechts met ons?"
null.verse 21:56: Hij antwoordde: "Neen, uw Heer is de Heer van de hemelen en van de aarde, Die deze schiep en ik leg getuigenis er van af.
null.verse 21:57: En, bij God, ik zal tegen uw afgoden een plan beramen nadat je hun uw rug hebt toegewend.
null.verse 21:58: Alsdan brak hij ze in stukken, behalve de grootste daarvan, opdat zij zich tot hem zouden wenden.
null.verse 21:59: (Toen zij dit zagen) zeiden zij: "Wie heeft dit onze Goden aangedaan? Voorwaar, hij moet een boosdoener zijn.
null.verse 21:60: Enigen hunner zeiden: "Wij hoorden een jonge man over hen spreken; hij heet Abraham.
null.verse 21:61: Zij zeiden: "Brengt hem dan voor de ogen des volks, opdat zij kunnen getuigen.
null.verse 21:62: Zij vroegen: "Heb je dit onze Goden aangedaan, o Abraham?"
null.verse 21:63: Hij antwoordde: "Iemand heeft het gedaan; dit is de grootste van hen.
null.verse 21:64: Toen kwamen zij tot inkeer en zeiden (bij zichzelf) "Gij zijt zelf de boosdoeners.
null.verse 21:65: En zij lieten (beschaamd) het hoofd hangen, "Gij weet wel dat deze niet kunnen spreken.
null.verse 21:66: Hij zeide: "Aanbid je dan in plaats van God datgene wat u geenszins kan baten noch schaden?"
null.verse 21:67: "Schande over u en over hetgeen je buiten God aanbidt.
null.verse 21:68: Zij zeiden: "Verbrandt hem en helpt uw goden indien je iets wilt doen.
null.verse 21:69: Wij zeiden: "O vuur, wees koel en onschadelijk voor Abraham.
null.verse 21:70: En zij wensten hem kwaad te doen doch Wij deden hen de grootste verliezers zijn.
null.verse 21:71: En Wij redden hem en Lot en voerden hen naar het land dat Wij zegenden voor alle volkeren.
null.verse 21:72: En Wij schonken hem Izaäk en Jacob als kleinzoon en Wij maakten hen allen rechtvaardig.
null.verse 21:73: En Wij maakten hen tot leiders die de mensen leidden op Ons bevel en Wij zonden een Openbaring tot hen, die aanspoorde, goede werken te doen, het gebed te onderhouden en aalmoezen te geven.
null.verse 21:74: En aan Lot schonken Wij wijsheid en kennis.
null.verse 21:75: En Wij namen hem in Onze barmhartigheid op, want hij was een der rechtvaardigen.
null.verse 21:76: En toen Noach voordien riep, verhoorden Wij zijn gebed en redden hem en zijn gezin uit de grote ramp.
null.verse 21:77: En Wij stonden hem bij tegen degenen die Onze tekenen verloochenden.
null.verse 21:78: En toen David en Salomo rechtspraken betreffende het veld waar de geiten van zekere mensen bij nacht graasden, waren Wij Getuige van hun oordeel.
null.verse 21:79: Wij schonken Salomo begrip van de zaak en aan elk hunner schonken Wij wijsheid en kennis.
null.verse 21:80: En Wij leerden hem de kunst, maliënkolders voor u te maken, opdat deze u zouden beschermen tegen aanvallen.
null.verse 21:81: En Wij maakten de geweldige wind aan Salomo onderdanig.
null.verse 21:82: En Wij maakten onder de duivels, die voor hem doken en daarnaast andere arbeid verrichtten en Wij waren het die over hen waakten.
null.verse 21:83: En (gedenk) Job toen hij tot zijn Heer riep, zeggende: "Kwelling heeft mij terneer geworpen en Gij zijt de Genadigste der genadigen.
null.verse 21:84: Wij verhoorden daarom zijn gebed en bevrijdden hem van moeilijkheden en gaven hem de zijnen en het gelijke er van daarnevens, als een bewijs Onzer barmhartigheid en als een herinnering voor de vromen.
null.verse 21:85: En Ismaël en Idries en Zol-Kifl; allen behoorden tot de standvastigen.
null.verse 21:86: En Wij namen hen op in Onze genade want zij behoorden tot de rechtvaardigen.
null.verse 21:87: En Zonnoen (Jonas) toen hij in toorn heenging en dacht dat Wij geen macht over hem hadden en in de duisternis uitriep, zeggende: "Er is geen God dan Gij.
null.verse 21:88: Wij verhoorden toen zijn gebed en namen zijn droefenis van hem weg.
null.verse 21:89: En Zacharia, toen hij tot zijn Heer riep, zeggende: "Mijn Heer, laat mij niet alleen en Gij zijt de Beste der erfgenamen.
null.verse 21:90: Toen verhoorden Wij zijn gebed en beloofden hem Johannes en Wij maakten zijn vrouw geschikt (een kind te krijgen).
null.verse 21:91: En (gedenk) haar, die haar kuisheid bewaarde; Wij bliezen haar Onze geest in en Wij maakten haar en haar zoon tot een teken voor alle volkeren.
null.verse 21:92: Voorwaar, dit is uw gemeenschap: één gemeenschap; en Ik ben uw Heer, aanbidt Mij derhalve.
null.verse 21:93: Doch zij (hun volgelingen) hebben hun eenheid verbroken; toch zullen zij allen tot Ons terugkeren.
null.verse 21:94: Wie ook goede werken verricht en een gelovige is, voor diens ijver zal geen ondankbaarheid zijn.
null.verse 21:95: En voor een stad die Wij verdelgd hebben, is het een onherroepelijk gebod, dat het (volk) niet zal terugkeren.
null.verse 21:96: Zelfs wanneer Gog en Magog zullen worden losgelaten en zij elke hoogte zullen overschrijden.
null.verse 21:97: En als de ware Belofte nadert, dan ziet, de ogen der ongelovigen zullen verstard zijn.
null.verse 21:98: Voorwaar, jij met hetgeen je buiten God aanbidt, zal de brandstof der hel zijn.
null.verse 21:99: Indien dezen werkelijk Goden waren geweest zouden zij niet daarin zijn gegaan; nu zullen allen er in verblijven.
null.verse 21:100: Daarin zullen zij weeklagen en niets horen.
null.verse 21:101: Voorzeker degenen, aan wie door Ons tevoren de belofte van een goede beloning is gedaan, dezen zullen er ver van verwijderd worden.
null.verse 21:102: Geen gerucht daarvan (van de hel) zullen zij horen, en zij zullen voor eeuwig vertoeven in hetgeen hun zielen begeren.
null.verse 21:103: De grote ontzetting zal hen niet beangstigen en de engelen zullen hen tegemoet komen, zeggende: "Dit is de Dag die u was beloofd.
null.verse 21:104: De Dag, waarop Wij de hemelen zullen oprollen zoals een schrijver zijn geschriften oprolt.
null.verse 21:105: En voordien hebben Wij na de Vermaning in de geschriften geschreven dat Mijn rechtvaardige dienaren de aarde zullen erven.
null.verse 21:106: Voorzeker, hierin ligt een boodschap voor mensen die God dienen.
null.verse 21:107: En Wij hebben u (Mohamed) slechts als genade voor de werelden gezonden.
null.verse 21:108: Zeg: "Voorzeker, mij is geopenbaard dat uw God slechts een enig God is, zul je u dan aan Hem onderwerpen?"
null.verse 21:109: Maar indien zij zich afwenden, zeg dan: "Ik heb u allen gelijkelijk ingelicht en ik weet niet of hetgeen waar je mee bedreigd wordt, nabij of ver is.
null.verse 21:110: "Voorwaar, Hij weet wat openlijk besproken wordt en Hij weet hetgeen je verbergt.
null.verse 21:111: "En ik weet niet of het voor u een beproeving is of een voordeel voor een bepaalde tijd.
null.verse 21:112: Zeg: "Mijn Heer, oordeel in waarheid.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:1: Their reckoning draweth nigh for mankind, while they turn away in heedlessness.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:2: Never cometh there unto them a new reminder from their Lord but they listen to it while they play,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:4: He saith: My Lord knoweth what is spoken in the heaven and the earth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:5: Nay, say they, (these are but) muddled dreams; nay, he hath but invented it; nay, he is but a poet.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:6: Not a township believed of those which We destroyed before them (though We sent them portents): would they then believe ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:7: And We sent not (as Our messengers) before thee other than men, whom We inspired.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:8: We gave them not bodies that would not eat food, nor were they immortals.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:9: Then we fulfilled the promise unto them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:10: Now We have revealed unto you a Scripture wherein is your Reminder.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:11: How many a community that dealt unjustly have We shattered, and raised up after them another folk!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:12: And, when they felt Our might, behold them fleeing from it!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:13: (But it was said unto them): Flee not, but return to that (existence) which emasculated you and to your dwellings, that ye may be questioned.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:14: They cried: Alas for us! we were wrong-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:15: And this their crying ceased not till We made them as reaped corn, extinct.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:16: We created not the heaven and the earth and all that is between them in play.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:17: If We had wished to find a pastime, We could have found it in Our presence - if We ever did.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:18: Nay, but We hurl the true against the false, and it doth break its head and lo! it vanisheth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:19: Unto Him belongeth whosoever is in the heavens and the earth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:20: They glorify (Him) night and day; they flag not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:21: Or have they chosen gods from the earth who raise the dead ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:22: If there were therein gods beside Allah, then verily both (the heavens and the earth) had been disordered.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:23: He will not be questioned as to that which He doeth, but they will be questioned.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:24: Or have they chosen other gods beside Him ? say: Bring your proof (of their godhead).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:25: And We sent no messenger before thee but We inspired him, (saying): There is no God save Me (Allah), so worship Me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:26: And they say: The Beneficent hath taken unto Himself a son.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:27: They speak not until He hath spoken, and they act by His command.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:28: He knoweth what is before them and what is behind them, and they cannot intercede except for him whom He accepteth, and they quake for awe of Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:29: And one of them who should say: Lo! I am a god beside Him, that one We should repay with hell.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:30: Have not those who disbelieve known that the heavens and the earth were of one piece, then We parted them, and we made every living thing of water ? Will they not then believe ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:31: And We have placed in the earth firm hills lest it quake with them, and We have placed therein ravines as roads that haply they may find their way.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:32: And we have made the sky a roof withheld (from them).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:33: And He it is Who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:34: We appointed immortality for no mortal before thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:35: Every soul must taste of death, and We try you with evil and with good, for ordeal.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:36: And when those who disbelieve behold thee, they but choose thee out for mockery, (saying): Is this he who maketh mention of your gods ? And they would deny all mention of the Beneficent.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:38: And they say: When will this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are truthful ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:39: If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not be able to drive off the fire from their faces and from their backs, and they will not be helped!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:40: Nay, but it will come upon them unawares so that it will stupefy them, and they will be unable to repel it, neither will they be reprieved.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:41: Messengers before thee, indeed, were mocked, but that whereat they mocked surrounded those who scoffed at them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:42: Say: Who guardeth you in the night or in the day from the Beneficent ? Nay, but they turn away from mention of their Lord!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:43: Or have they gods who can shield them from Us ? They cannot help themselves nor can they be defended from Us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:44: Nay, but We gave these and their fathers ease until life grew long for them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:45: Say (O Muhammad, unto mankind): I warn you only by the Inspiration.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:46: And if a breath of thy Lord’s punishment were to touch them, they assuredly would say: Alas for us! Lo! we were wrong-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:47: And We set a just balance for the Day of Resurrection so that no soul is wronged in aught.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:48: And We verily gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion (of right and wrong) and a light and a Reminder for those who keep from evil,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:49: Those who fear their Lord in secret and who dread the Hour (of doom).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:50: This is a blessed Reminder that we have revealed: Will ye then reject it ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:51: And We verily gave Abraham of old his proper course, and We were Aware of him,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:52: When he said unto his father and his folk: What are these images unto which ye pay devotion ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:53: They said: We found our fathers worshippers of them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:54: He said: Verily ye and your fathers were in plain error.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:55: They said: Bringest thou unto us the truth, or art thou some jester ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:56: He said: Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them; and I am of those who testify unto that.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:57: And, by Allah, I shall circumvent your idols after ye have gone away and turned your backs.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:58: Then he reduced them to fragments, all save the chief of them, that haply they might have recourse to it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:59: They said: Who hath done this to our gods ? Surely it must be some evil-doer.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:60: They said: We heard a youth make mention of them, who is called Abraham.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:61: They said: Then bring him (hither) before the people’s eyes that they may testify.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:62: They said: Is it thou who hast done this to our gods, O Abraham ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:63: He said: But this, their chief hath done it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:64: Then gathered they apart and said: Lo! ye yourselves are the wrong-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:65: And they were utterly confounded, and they said: Well thou knowest that these speak not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:66: He said: Worship ye then instead of Allah that which cannot profit you at all, nor harm you ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:67: Fie on you and all that ye worship instead of Allah! Have ye then no sense ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:68: They cried: Burn him and stand by your gods, if ye will be doing.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:69: We said: O fire, be coolness and peace for Abraham,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:70: And they wished to set a snare for him, but We made them the greater losers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:71: And We rescued him and Lot (and brought them) to the land which We have blessed for (all) peoples.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:72: And We bestowed upon him Isaac, and Jacob as a grandson.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:73: And We made them chiefs who guide by Our command, and We inspired in them the doing of good deeds and the right establishment of worship and the giving of alms, and they were worshippers of Us (alone).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:74: And unto Lot we gave judgment and knowledge, and We delivered him from the community that did abominations.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:75: And We brought him in unto Our mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:76: And Noah, when he cried of old, We heard his prayer and saved him and his household from the great affliction.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:77: And delivered him from the people who denied Our revelations.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:78: And David and Solomon, when they gave judgment concerning the field, when people’s sheep had strayed and browsed therein by night; and We were witnesses to their judgment.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:79: And We made Solomon to understand (the case); and unto each of them We gave judgment and knowledge.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:80: And We taught him the art of making garments (of mail) to protect you in your daring.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:81: And unto Solomon (We subdued) the wind in its raging.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:82: And of the evil ones (subdued We unto him) some who dived (for pearls) for him and did other work, and We were warders unto them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:83: And Job, when he cried unto his Lord, (saying): Lo! adversity afflicteth me, and Thou art Most Merciful of all who show mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:84: Then We heard his prayer and removed that adversity from which he suffered, and We gave him his household (that he had lost) and the like thereof along with them, a mercy from Our store, and a remembrance for the worshippers;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:85: And (mention) Ishmael, and Idris, and Dhu’l-Kifl.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:86: And We brought them in unto Our mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:87: And (mention) Dhu’n-Nun, when he went off in anger and deemed that We had no power over him, but he cried out in the darkness, saying: There is no God save Thee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:88: Then we heard his prayer and saved him from the anguish.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:89: And Zachariah, when he cried unto his Lord: My Lord! Leave me not childless, though Thou art the Best of inheritors.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:90: Then We heard his prayer, and bestowed upon him John, and adjusted his wife (to bear a child) for him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:91: And she who was chaste, therefor We breathed into her (something) of Our Spirit and made her and her son a token for (all) peoples.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:92: Lo! this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:93: And they have broken their religion (into fragments) among them, (yet) all are returning unto Us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:94: Then whoso doeth some good works and is a believer, there will be no rejection of his effort.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:95: And there is a ban upon any community which We have destroyed: that they shall not return.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:96: Until, when Gog and Magog are let loose, and they hasten out of every mound,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:97: And the True Promise draweth nigh; then behold them, staring wide (in terror), the eyes of those who disbelieve! (They say): Alas for us! We (lived) in forgetfulness of this.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:98: Lo! ye (idolaters) and that which ye worship beside Allah are fuel of hell.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:99: If these had been gods they would not have come thither, but all will abide therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:100: Therein wailing is their portion, and therein they hear not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:101: Lo! those unto whom kindness hath gone forth before from Us, they will be far removed from thence.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:102: TThey will not hear the slightest sound thereof, while they abide in that which their souls desire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:103: The Supreme Horror will not grieve them, and the angels will welcome them, (saying): This is your Day which ye were promised;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:104: The Day when We shall roll up the heavens as a recorder rolleth up a written scroll.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:105: And verily we have written in the Scripture, after the Reminder: My righteous slaves will inherit the earth:
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:106: Lo! there is a plain statement for folk who are devout.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:107: We sent thee not save as a mercy for the peoples.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:108: Say: It is only inspired in me that your God is One God.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:109: But if they are averse, then say: I have warned you all alike, although I know not whether nigh or far is that which ye are promised.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:110: Lo! He knoweth that which is said openly, and that which ye conceal.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:111: And I know not but that this may be a trial for you, and enjoyment for a while.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 21:112: He saith: My Lord! Judge Thou with truth.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:1: Closer and closer to mankind comes their Reckoning: yet they heed not and they turn away.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:2: Never comes (aught) to them of a renewed Message from their Lord, but they listen to it as in jest,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:3: Their hearts toying as with trifles.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:4: Say: "My Lord knoweth (every) word (spoken) in the heavens and on earth: He is the One that heareth and knoweth (all things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:5: "Nay," they say, "(these are) medleys of dream! - Nay, He forged it! - Nay, He is (but) a poet! Let him then bring us a Sign like the ones that were sent to (Prophets) of old!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:6: (As to those) before them, not one of the populations which We destroyed believed: will these believe?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:7: Before thee, also, the apostles We sent were but men, to whom We granted inspiration: If ye realise this not, ask of those who possess the Message.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:8: Nor did We give them bodies that ate no food, nor were they exempt from death.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:9: In the end We fulfilled to them Our Promise, and We saved them and those whom We pleased, but We destroyed those who transgressed beyond bounds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:10: We have revealed for you (O men!) a book in which is a Message for you: will ye not then understand?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:11: How many were the populations We utterly destroyed because of their iniquities, setting up in their places other peoples?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:12: Yet, when they felt Our Punishment (coming), behold, they (tried to) flee from it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:13: Flee not, but return to the good things of this life which were given you, and to your homes in order that ye may be called to account.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:14: They said: "Ah! woe to us! We were indeed wrong-doers!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:15: And that cry of theirs ceased not, till We made them as a field that is mown, as ashes silent and quenched.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:16: Not for (idle) sport did We create the heavens and the earth and all that is between!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:17: If it had been Our wish to take (just) a pastime, We should surely have taken it from the things nearest to Us, if We would do (such a thing)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:18: Nay, We hurl the Truth against falsehood, and it knocks out its brain, and behold, falsehood doth perish! Ah! woe be to you for the (false) things ye ascribe (to Us).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:19: To Him belong all (creatures) in the heavens and on earth: Even those who are in His (very) Presence are not too proud to serve Him, nor are they (ever) weary (of His service):
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:20: They celebrate His praises night and day, nor do they ever flag or intermit.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:21: Or have they taken (for worship) gods from the earth who can raise (the dead)?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:22: If there were, in the heavens and the earth, other gods besides God, there would have been confusion in both! but glory to God, the Lord of the Throne: (High is He) above what they attribute to Him!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:23: He cannot be questioned for His acts, but they will be questioned (for theirs).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:24: Or have they taken for worship (other) gods besides him? Say, "Bring your convincing proof: this is the Message of those with me and the Message of those before me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:25: Not an apostle did We send before thee without this inspiration sent by Us to him: that there is no god but I; therefore worship and serve Me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:26: And they say: "(God) Most Gracious has begotten offspring.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:27: They speak not before He speaks, and they act (in all things) by His Command.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:28: He knows what is before them, and what is behind them, and they offer no intercession except for those who are acceptable, and they stand in awe and reverence of His (Glory).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:29: If any of them should say, "I am a god besides Him", such a one We should reward with Hell: thus do We reward those who do wrong.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:30: Do not the Unbelievers see that the heavens and the earth were joined together (as one unit of creation), before we clove them asunder? We made from water every living thing.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:31: And We have set on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with them, and We have made therein broad highways (between mountains) for them to pass through: that they may receive Guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:32: And We have made the heavens as a canopy well guarded: yet do they turn away from the Signs which these things (point to)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:33: It is He Who created the Night and the Day, and the sun and the moon: all (the celestial bodies) swim along, each in its rounded course.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:34: We granted not to any man before thee permanent life (here): if then thou shouldst die, would they live permanently?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:35: Every soul shall have a taste of death: and We test you by evil and by good by way of trial.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:36: When the Unbelievers see thee, they treat thee not except with ridicule.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:37: Man is a creature of haste: soon (enough) will I show you My Signs; then ye will not ask Me to hasten them!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:38: They say: "When will this promise come to pass, if ye are telling the truth?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:39: If only the Unbelievers knew (the time) when they will not be able to ward off the fire from their faces, nor yet from their backs, and (when) no help can reach them!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:40: Nay, it may come to them all of a sudden and confound them: no power will they have then to avert it, nor will they (then) get respite.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:41: Mocked were (many) apostle before thee; But their scoffers were hemmed in by the thing that they mocked.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:42: Say: "Who can keep you safe by night and by day from (the Wrath of) (God) Most Gracious?" Yet they turn away from the mention of their Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:43: Or have they gods that can guard them from Us? They have no power to aid themselves, nor can they be defended from Us.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:44: Nay, We gave the good things of this life to these men and their fathers until the period grew long for them; See they not that We gradually reduce the land (in their control) from its outlying borders? Is it then they who will win?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:45: Say, "I do but warn you according to revelation": But the deaf will not hear the call, (even) when they are warned!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:46: If but a breath of the Wrath of thy Lord do touch them, they will then say, "Woe to us! we did wrong indeed!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:47: We shall set up scales of justice for the Day of Judgment, so that not a soul will be dealt with unjustly in the least, and if there be (no more than) the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it (to account): and enough are We to take account.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:48: In the past We granted to Moses and Aaron the criterion (for judgment), and a Light and a Message for those who would do right,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:49: Those who fear their Lord in their most secret thoughts, and who hold the Hour (of Judgment) in awe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:50: And this is a blessed Message which We have sent down: will ye then reject it?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:51: We bestowed aforetime on Abraham his rectitude of conduct, and well were We acquainted with him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:52: Behold! he said to his father and his people, "What are these images, to which ye are (so assiduously) devoted?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:53: They said, "We found our fathers worshipping them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:54: He said, "Indeed ye have been in manifest error - ye and your fathers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:55: They said, "Have you brought us the Truth, or are you one of those who jest?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:56: He said, "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, He Who created them (from nothing): and I am a witness to this (Truth).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:57: "And by God, I have a plan for your idols - after ye go away and turn your backs".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:58: So he broke them to pieces, (all) but the biggest of them, that they might turn (and address themselves) to it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:59: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? He must indeed be some man of impiety!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:60: They said, "We heard a youth talk of them: He is called Abraham.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:61: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may bear witness.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:62: They said, "Art thou the one that did this with our gods, O Abraham?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:63: He said: "Nay, this was done by - this is their biggest one! ask them, if they can speak intelligently!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:64: So they turned to themselves and said, "Surely ye are the ones in the wrong!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:65: Then were they confounded with shame: (they said), "Thou knowest full well that these (idols) do not speak!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:66: (Abraham) said, "Do ye then worship, besides God, things that can neither be of any good to you nor do you harm?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:67: "Fie upon you, and upon the things that ye worship besides God! Have ye no sense?".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:68: They said, "Burn him and protect your gods, If ye do (anything at all)!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:69: We said, "O Fire! be thou cool, and (a means of) safety for Abraham!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:70: Then they sought a stratagem against him: but We made them the ones that lost most!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:71: But We delivered him and (his nephew) Lut (and directed them) to the land which We have blessed for the nations.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:72: And We bestowed on him Isaac and, as an additional gift, (a grandson), Jacob, and We made righteous men of every one (of them).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:73: And We made them leaders, guiding (men) by Our Command, and We sent them inspiration to do good deeds, to establish regular prayers, and to practise regular charity; and they constantly served Us (and Us only).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:74: And to Lut, too, We gave Judgment and Knowledge, and We saved him from the town which practised abominations: truly they were a people given to Evil, a rebellious people.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:75: And We admitted him to Our Mercy: for he was one of the Righteous
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:76: (Remember) Noah, when he cried (to Us) aforetime: We listened to his (prayer) and delivered him and his family from great distress.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:77: We helped him against people who rejected Our Signs: truly they were a people given to Evil: so We drowned them (in the Flood) all together.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:78: And remember David and Solomon, when they gave judgment in the matter of the field into which the sheep of certain people had strayed by night: We did witness their judgment.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:79: To Solomon We inspired the (right) understanding of the matter: to each (of them) We gave Judgment and Knowledge; it was Our power that made the hills and the birds celebrate Our praises, with David: it was We Who did (all these things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:80: It was We Who taught him the making of coats of mail for your benefit, to guard you from each other’s violence: will ye then be grateful?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:81: (It was Our power that made) the violent (unruly) wind flow (tamely) for Solomon, to his order, to the land which We had blessed: for We do know all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:82: And of the evil ones, were some who dived for him, and did other work besides; and it was We Who guarded them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:83: And (remember) Job, when He cried to his Lord, "Truly distress has seized me, but Thou art the Most Merciful of those that are merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:84: So We listened to him: We removed the distress that was on him, and We restored his people to him, and doubled their number,- as a Grace from Ourselves, and a thing for commemoration, for all who serve Us.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:85: And (remember) Isma’il, Idris, and Zul-kifl, all (men) of constancy and patience;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:86: We admitted them to Our mercy: for they were of the righteous ones.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:87: And remember Zun-nun, when he departed in wrath: He imagined that We had no power over him! But he cried through the deptHs of darkness, "There is no god but thou: glory to thee: I was indeed wrong!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:88: So We listened to him: and delivered him from distress: and thus do We deliver those who have faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:89: And (remember) Zakariya, when he cried to his Lord: "O my Lord! leave me not without offspring, though thou art the best of inheritors.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:90: So We listened to him: and We granted him Yahya: We cured his wife’s (Barrenness) for him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:91: And (remember) her who guarded her chastity: We breathed into her of Our spirit, and We made her and her son a sign for all peoples.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:92: Verily, this brotherhood of yours is a single brotherhood, and I am your Lord and Cherisher: therefore serve Me (and no other).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:93: But (later generations) cut off their affair (of unity), one from another: (yet) will they all return to Us.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:94: Whoever works any act of righteousness and has faith,- His endeavour will not be rejected: We shall record it in his favour.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:95: But there is a ban on any population which We have destroyed: that they shall not return,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:96: Until the Gog and Magog (people) are let through (their barrier), and they swiftly swarm from every hill.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:97: Then will the true promise draw nigh (of fulfilment): then behold! the eyes of the Unbelievers will fixedly stare in horror: "Ah! Woe to us! we were indeed heedless of this; nay, we truly did wrong!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:98: Verily ye, (unbelievers), and the (false) gods that ye worship besides God, are (but) fuel for Hell! to it will ye (surely) come!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:99: If these had been gods, they would not have got there! but each one will abide therein.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:100: There, sobbing will be their lot, nor will they there hear (aught else).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:101: Those for whom the good (record) from Us has gone before, will be removed far therefrom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:102: Not the slightest sound will they hear of Hell: what their souls desired, in that will they dwell.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:103: The Great Terror will bring them no grief: but the angels will meet them (with mutual greetings): "This is your Day,- (the Day) that ye were promised.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:104: The Day that We roll up the heavens like a scroll rolled up for books (completed),- even as We produced the first creation, so shall We produce a new one: a promise We have undertaken: truly shall We fulfil it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:105: Before this We wrote in the Psalms, after the Message (given to Moses): My servants the righteous, shall inherit the earth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:106: Verily in this (Qur’an) is a Message for people who would (truly) worship God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:107: We sent thee not, but as a Mercy for all creatures.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:108: Say: "What has come to me by inspiration is that your God is One God: will ye therefore bow to His Will (in Islam)?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:109: But if they turn back, Say: "I have proclaimed the Message to you all alike and in truth; but I know not whether that which ye are promised is near or far.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:110: "It is He Who knows what is open in speech and what ye hide (in your hearts).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:111: "I know not but that it may be a trial for you, and a grant of (worldly) livelihood (to you) for a time.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 21:112: Say: "O my Lord! judge Thou in truth!" "Our Lord Most Gracious is the One Whose assistance should be sought against the blasphemies ye utter!"

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:1: Nigh unto men has drawn their reckoning, while they in heedlessness are yet turning away;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:2: no Remembrance from their Lord comes to them lately renewed, but they listen to it yet playing,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:4: He says: ’My Lord knows what is said in the heavens and the earth, and He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:5: Nay, but they say: ’A hotchpotch of nightmares! Nay, he has forged it; nay, he is a poet! Now therefore let him bring us a sign, even as the ancient ones were sent as Messengers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:6: Not one city that We destroyed before them believed; what then, will they not believe?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:7: And We sent none before thee, but men to whom We made revelation -- question the People of the Remembrance, if you do not know --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:8: nor did We fashion them as bodies that ate not food, neither were they immortal;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:9: then We made true the promise We gave them and We delivered them, and whomsoever We would; and We destroyed the prodigal.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:10: Now We have sent down to you a Book wherein is your Remembrance; will you not understand?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:11: How many a city that was evildoing We have shattered, and set up after it another people!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:12: Then, when they perceived Our might, behold, they ran headlong out of it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:13: ’Run not! Return you unto the luxury that you exulted in, and your dwelling-places; haply you shall be questioned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:14: They said, ’Alas for us! We have been evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:15: So they ceased not to cry, until We made them stubble, silent and still.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:16: We created not the heaven and the earth, and whatsoever between them is, as playing;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:17: had We desired to take to Us a diversion We would have taken it to Us from Ourselves, had We done aught.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:18: Nay, but We hurl the truth against falsehood and it prevails over it, and behold, falsehood vanishes away.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:19: To Him belongs whosoever is in the heavens and the earth; and those who are with Him wax not too proud to do Him service neither grow weary,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:20: glorifying Him by night and in the daytime and never failing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:21: Or have they taken gods out of the earth who raise the dead?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:22: Why, were there gods in earth and heaven other than God, they would surely go to ruin; so glory be to God, the Lord of the Throne, above that they describe!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:23: He shall not be questioned as to what He does, but they shall he questioned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:24: Or have they taken gods apart from Him? Say: ’Bring your proof! This is the Remembrance of him who is with me, and the Remembrance of those before me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:25: And We sent never a Messenger before thee except that We revealed to him, saying, ’There is no god but I; so serve Me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:26: They say:’ ’The All-merciful has taken to Him a son.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:27: that outstrip Him not in speech, and perform as He commands.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:28: He knows what is before them and behind them, and they intercede not save for him with whom He is well-pleased, and they tremble in awe of Him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:29: If any of them says, ’I am a god apart from Him’, such a one We recompense with Gehenna; even so We recompense the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:30: Have not the unbelievers then beheld that the heavens and the earth were a mass all sewn up, and then We unstitched them and of water fashioned every living thing? Will they not believe?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:31: And We set in the earth firm mountains lest it should shake with them, and We set in it ravines to serve as ways, that haply so they may be guided;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:32: and We set up the heaven as a roof well-protected; yet still from Our signs they are turning away.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:33: It is He who created the night and the day, the sun and the moon, each swimming in a sky.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:34: We have not assigned to any mortal before thee to live forever; therefore, if thou diest, will they live forever?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:35: Every soul shall taste of death; and We try you with evil and good for a testing, then unto Us you shall be returned
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:36: When the unbelievers behold thee, they take thee only for mockery: ’Ha, is this the one who makes mention of your gods?’ Yet they in the Remembrance of the All-merciful are unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:38: They say, ’And when shall the promise come to pass, if you speak truly?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:39: If the unbelievers but knew when that they shall not ward off the Fire from their faces nor from their backs, neither shall they be helped!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:40: Nay, but it shall come upon them suddenly, dumbfounding them, and they shall not be able to repel it, nor shall they be respited.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:41: Messengers indeed were mocked at before thee, but those that scoffed at them were encompassed by that they mocked at.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:42: Say: ’Who shall guard you by night and in the daytime from the All-merciful?’ Nay, but from the Remembrance of their Lord they are turning away.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:43: Or have they gods that shall defend them apart from Us? Why, they are not able to help themselves, nor shall they be guarded in safety from Us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:44: Nay, but Ourselves gave these and their fathers enjoyment of days, until their life had lasted long while upon them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:45: Say: ’I warn you only by the Revelation’; but they that are deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:46: If but a breath of thy Lord’s chastisement touched them, they would surely say, ’Alas for us! We were evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:47: And We shall set up the just balances for the Resurrection Day, so that not one soul shall be wronged anything; even if it be the weight of one grain of mustard-seed We shall produce it, and sufficient are We for reckoners.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:48: We gave Moses and Aaron the Salvation and a Radiance, and a Remembrance for the godfearing
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:49: such as fear God in the Unseen, trembling because of the Hour.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:50: And this is a blessed Remembrance that We have sent down; so are you now denying it?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:51: We gave Abraham aforetime his rectitude -- for We knew him --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:52: when he said to his father and his people, ’What are these statues unto which you are cleaving?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:53: They said, ’We found our fathers serving them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:54: He said, ’Then assuredly you and your fathers have been in manifest error.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:55: They said, ’What, hast thou come to us with the truth, or art thou one of those that play?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:56: He said, ’Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who originated them, and I am one of those that bear witness thereunto.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:57: And, by God, I shall assuredly outwit your idols, after you have gone away turning your backs.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:58: So he broke them into fragments, all but a great one they had, for haply they would return to it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:60: They said, ’We heard a young man making mention of them, and he was called Abraham.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:61: They said, ’Bring him before the people’s eyes; haply they shall bear witness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:62: They said, ’So, art thou the man who did this unto our gods, Abraham?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:63: He said, ’No; it was this great one of them that did it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:64: So they returned one to another, and they said, ’Surely it is you who are the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:65: Then they were utterly put to confusion saying, ’Very well indeed thou knowest these do not speak.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:66: He said, ’What, and do you serve, apart from God, that which profits you nothing; neither hurts you?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:67: Fie upon you and that you serve apart from God! Do you not understand?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:68: They said, ’Burn him, and help your gods, if you would do aught.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:69: We said, ’O fire, be coolness and safety for Abraham!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:70: They desired to outwit him; so We made them the worse losers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:71: and We delivered him, and Lot, unto the land that We had blessed for all beings.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:72: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in superfluity, and every one made We righteous
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:73: and appointed them to be leaders guiding by Our command, and We revealed to them the doing of good deeds, and to perform the prayer, and to pay the alms, and Us they served.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:74: And Lot -- to him We gave judgment and knowledge; and we delivered him from the city that had been doing deeds of corruption; they were an evil people, truly ungodly;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:75: and We admitted him into Our mercy; he was of the righteous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:76: And Noah -- when he called before, and We answered him, and delivered him and his people from the great distress,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:77: and We helped him against the people who cried lies to Our signs; surely they were an evil people, so We drowned them all together.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:78: And David and Solomon -- when they gave judgment concerning the tillage, when the sheep of the people strayed there, and We bore witness to their judgment;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:79: and We made Solomon to understand it, and unto each gave We judgment and knowledge.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:80: And We taught him the fashioning of garments for you, to fortify you against your violence; then are you thankful?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:81: And to Solomon the wind, strongly blowing, that ran at his command unto the land that We had blessed; and We had knowledge of everything;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:82: and of the Satans some dived for him and did other work besides; and We were watching over them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:83: And Job -- when he called unto his Lord, ’Behold, affliction has visited me, and Thou art the most merciful of the merciful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:84: So We answered him, and removed the affliction that was upon him, and We gave his people, and the like of them with them, mercy from Us, and a Reminder to those who serve.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:85: And Ishmael, Idris, Dhul Kifl -- each was of the patient,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:86: and We admitted them into Our mercy; they were of the righteous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:87: And Dhul Nun -- when he went forth enraged and thought that We would have no power over him; then he called out in the darkness, ’There is no god but Thou.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:88: So We answered him, and delivered him out of grief; even so do, We deliver the believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:89: And Zachariah -- when he called unto his Lord, ’O my Lord, leave me not solitary; though Thou art the best of inheritors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:90: So We answered him, and bestowed on him John, and We set his wife right for him; truly they vied with one another, hastening to good works, and called upon Us out of yearning and awe; and they were humble to Us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:91: And she who guarded her virginity, so We breathed into her of Our spirit and appointed her and her son to be a sign unto all beings.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:92: ’Surely this community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord; so serve Me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:93: But they split up their affair between them; all shall return to Us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:94: And whosoever does deeds of righteousness, being a believer, no unthankfulness shall befall his endeavour; We Ourselves write it down for him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:95: There is a ban upon any city that We have destroyed; they shall not return
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:96: till, when Gog and Magog are unloosed, and they slide down out of every slope,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:97: and nigh has drawn the true promise, and behold, the eyes of the unbelievers staring: ’Alas for us! We were heedless of this; ’nay, we were evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:98: ’Surely you, and that you were serving apart from God, are fuel for Gehenna; you shall go down to it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:99: If those had been gods, they would never have gone down to it; yet every one of them shall therein abide forever;’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:100: there shall be sighing for them therein, and naught they shall hear.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:101: But as for those unto whom already the reward most fair has gone forth from Us,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:102: they shall be, kept far from it neither shall they hear any whisper of it, and they shall dwell forever in that their souls desired;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:103: the greatest terror shall not grieve them, and the angels shall receive them: ’This is your day that you were promised.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:104: On the day when We shall roll up heaven as a scroll is rolled for the writings; as We originated the first creation, so We shall bring it back again -- a promise binding on Us; so We shall do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:105: For We have written in the Psalms, after the Remembrance, ’The earth shall be the inheritance of My righteous servants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:106: Surely in this is a Message delivered unto a people who serve.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:107: We have not sent thee, save as a mercy unto all beings.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:108: Say: ’It is revealed unto me only that your God is One God; do you then surrender?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:109: Then, if they should turn their backs, say: ’I have proclaimed to you all equally, even though I know not whether near or far is that you are promised.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:110: Surely He knows what is spoken aloud and He knows what you hide.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:111: I know not; haply it is a trial for you and an enjoyment for a time.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 21:112: He said: ’My Lord, judge Thou with truth! And our Lord is the All-merciful; His succour is ever to be sought against that you describe.

Muhammad Asad.verse 21:1: CLOSER DRAWS unto men their reckoning: and yet they remain stubbornly heedless [of its approach].
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:2: Whenever there comes unto them any new reminder from their Sustainer, they but listen to it with playful amusement,
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:3: their hearts set on passing delights; yet they who are
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:4: bent on wrongdoing conceal their innermost thoughts [when they say to one another], "Is this
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:5: anything but a mortal like yourselves? Will you, then, yield to
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:6: spellbinding eloquence with your eyes open?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:7: Say: "My Sustainer knows whatever is spoken in heaven and on earth; and He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:8: "Nay," they say, "[Muhammad propounds] the most involved and confusing of dreams!" – "Nay, but he has invented
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:11: "Let him, then, come unto us with a miracle, just as those
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:13: Not one of the communities that We destroyed in bygone times would ever believe [their prophets]: will these, then, [be more willing to] believe?
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:15: before thy time, [O Muhammad,] We never sent [as Our apostles] any but
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:16: men, whom We inspired – hence, [tell the deniers of the truth,] "If you do not know this, ask the followers of earlier revelation"
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:17: and neither did We endow them with bodies that could dispense with food, nor were they immortal.
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:18: In the end, We made good unto them Our promise, and We saved them and all whom We willed [to save], and We destroyed those who had wasted their own selves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:19: [O MEN!] We have now bestowed upon you from on high a divine writ containing all that you ought to bear in mind: will you not, then, use your reason?
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:20: For, how many a community that persisted in evildoing have We dashed into fragments, and raised another people in its stead!
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:21: And [every time,] as soon as they began to feel Our punishing might, lo! they tried to flee from it
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:22: [and at the same time they seemed to hear a scornful voice]: "Do not try to flee, but return to all that
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:23: gave you pleasure and corrupted your whole being, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:24: to your homes, so that you might be called to account [for what you have done]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:25: And they could only cry: "Oh, woe unto us! Verily, we were wrongdoers!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:26: And that cry of theirs did not cease until We caused them to become
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:27: a field mown down, still and silent as ashes.
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:28: AND [know that] We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in mere idle play:
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:30: had We willed to indulge in a pastime, We would indeed have produced it from within Ourselves – if such had been Our will at all!
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:31: Nay, but [by the very act of creation] We hurl the truth against falsehood, and it crushes the latter: and lo! it withers away.
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:33: that are in the heavens and on earth, and those that are with Him are never too proud to worship Him and never grow weary :
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:34: they extol His limitless glory by night and by day, never flagging .
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:35: And yet, some people choose to worship certain earthly things or beings as deities that [are supposed to] resurrect [the dead; and they fail to realize that],
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:36: had there been in heaven or on earth any deities other than God, both [those realms] would surely have fallen into ruin!But limitless in His glory is God, enthroned in His awesome almightiness
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:37: above anything that men may devise by way of definition!
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:38: He cannot be called to account for whatever He does, whereas they will be called to account:
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:39: and yet, they choose to worship
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:40: deities instead of Him!Say [O Prophet]: "Produce an evidence for what you are claiming: this is a reminder [unceasingly voiced] by those who are with me, just as it was a reminder
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:41: by those who came before me.
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:42: and [this despite the fact that even] before thy time We never sent any apostle without having revealed to him that there is no deity save Me, [and that,] therefore, you shall worship Me !
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:44: some say, "The Most Gracious has taken unto Himself a son"!Limitless is He in His glory! Nay, [those whom they regard as God’s "offspring" are but His] honoured servants:
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:45: they speak not until He has spoken unto them, and [whenever they act,] they act at His behest.
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:46: He knows all that lies open before them and all that is hidden from them: hence, they cannot intercede for any but those whom He has
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:47: graced with His goodly acceptance, since they themselves stand in reverent awe of Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:48: And if any of them were to say, "Behold, I am a deity beside Him" – that one We should requite with hell: thus do We requite all
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:50: ARE, THEN, they who are bent on denying the truth not aware that the heavens and the earth were
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:51: one single entity, which We then parted asunder? – and
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:52: We made out of water every living thing? Will they not, then, begin to believe?
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:53: And [are they not aware that] We have set up firm mountains on earth, lest it sway with them and
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:54: We have appointed thereon broad paths, so that they might find their way,
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:56: We have set up the sky as a canopy well-secured? And yet, they stubbornly turn away from
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:58: and [fail to see that] it is He who has created the night and the day and the sun and the moon – all of them floating through space!
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:59: AND [remind those who deny thee, O Prophet, that] never have We granted life everlasting to any mortal before thee: but do they, perchance, hope that although thou must die, they will live forever?
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:60: Every human being is bound to taste death; and We test you
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:61: through the bad and the good [things of life] by way of trial: and unto Us you all must return.
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:62: But [thus it is:] whenever they who are bent on denying the truth consider thee, they make thee but a target of their mockery, [saying to one another,] "Is this the one who speaks [so contemptuously] of your gods?" And yet, it is they themselves who, at
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:63: mention of the Most Gracious, are wont to deny the truth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:64: Man is a creature of haste; [but in time] I shall make obvious to you [the truth of] My messages: do not, then, ask Me to hasten !
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:65: But they [who reject My messages are wont to] ask, "When is that promise [of God’s judgment] to be fulfilled? [Answer this, O you who believe in it,] if you are men of truth!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:66: If they but knew – they who are bent on denying the truth – [that there will come] a time when they will not be able to ward off the fire from their faces, nor from their backs, and will not find any succour!
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:67: Nay, but [the Last Hour] will come upon them of a sudden, and will stupefy them: and they will be unable to avert it, and neither will they be allowed any respite.
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:68: And, indeed, [O Muhammad, even] before thy time have
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:69: apostles been derided – but those who scoffed at them were [in the end] overwhelmed by the very thing which they had been wont to deride.
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:70: Say: "Who could protect you, by night or by day, from the Most Gracious?" And yet, from a remembrance of their Sustainer do they stubbornly turn away!
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:71: Do they [really think that they] have deities that could shield them from Us? Those [alleged deities] are not
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:72: able to succour themselves: hence, neither can they [who worship them hope to] be aided [by them] against Us.
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:74: – as [We allowed] their forebears – to enjoy the good things of life for a great length of time: but then – have they never yet seen how We visit the earth [with Our punishment], gradually depriving it of all that is best thereon? Can they, then, [hope to] be the winners?
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:75: SAY [unto all men]: "I but warn you on the strength of divine revelation!"But the deaf [of heart] will not hearken to this call, however often they are warned.
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:76: And yet, if but a breath of thy Sustainer’s chastisement touches them, they are sure to cry, "Oh, woe unto us! Verily, we were evildoers!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 21:77: But We shall set up just balance-scales on Resurrection Day, and no human being shall be wronged in the least: for though there be [in him but] the weight of a mustard-seed [of good or evil], We shall bring it forth; and none can take count as We do!
